definitions: process of combining genetic material from two different species or varieties to create offspring with mixed characteristics
examples: The hybridisation of wheat varieties improved crop yields significantly
Natural hybridisation between species can occur in overlapping habitats

definitions: process of combining genetic material from two different species or varieties to create offspring with mixed characteristics
examples: Hybridization techniques have revolutionized agricultural production worldwide
The scientist studied hybridization patterns in wild bird populations

definitions: small freshwater organism with tentacles that can regenerate body parts
mythological serpent with multiple heads that grow back when cut off
examples: The biology student observed hydra reproducing through budding
Scientists study hydra for insights into regenerative medicine
The hero faced the hydra in Greek mythology stories
Fighting corruption is like battling a hydra with endless heads

definitions: ornamental shrub with large clusters of pink, blue, or white flowers
examples: The garden featured beautiful hydrangea bushes along the pathway
Blue hydrangea flowers require acidic soil to maintain color

definitions: upright pipe with valve for drawing water from street mains to fight fires
examples: Firefighters connected their hoses to the nearby fire hydrant
The city painted all hydrants yellow for better visibility

definitions: chemical compound containing water molecules combined with another substance
examples: Copper sulfate hydrate contains five water molecules per formula
The chemist studied various salt hydrates in the laboratory

definitions: process of combining with water or maintaining adequate water levels in body tissues
examples: Proper hydration is essential during intense physical exercise
The hydration of cement creates strong concrete structures

definitions: organic compound consisting entirely of hydrogen and carbon atoms found in fossil fuels
examples: Natural gas consists primarily of methane and other hydrocarbons
Petroleum refineries process hydrocarbons into various fuel products

definitions: electricity produced by converting the energy of flowing or falling water through turbines
examples: The dam generates hydroelectricity for millions of homes nearby
Countries with rivers often rely heavily on hydroelectricity production

definitions: wing-like structure that lifts boat hull above water at high speeds
boat equipped with underwater wings that lift it above water surface
examples: The hydrofoil design reduces water resistance at high speeds
Engineers tested different hydrofoil shapes in the water tunnel
The passenger hydrofoil traveled between islands at incredible speeds
Modern hydrofoil vessels can reach speeds over sixty knots

definitions: lightest chemical element that forms water when combined with oxygen
examples: Hydrogen fuel cells produce electricity with water as byproduct
The universe contains more hydrogen than any other element

definitions: scientific study of water movement, distribution, and quality on Earth and other planets
examples: The hydrology department monitors river flow patterns throughout the year
Understanding regional hydrology helps predict flooding and drought risks

definitions: high-speed boat designed to skim across water surface
loss of tire traction when vehicle slides on wet road surface
examples: The racing hydroplane broke speed records on the lake
Vintage hydroplane exhibitions draw thousands of spectators annually
Drivers should slow down to avoid hydroplane accidents on wet roads
The car began to hydroplane dangerously on the flooded highway

definitions: therapeutic use of water through baths, pools, or jets to treat medical conditions
examples: The physical therapist recommended hydrotherapy for joint rehabilitation
Spa centers offer various hydrotherapy treatments for stress relief

definitions: dog-like carnivorous mammal native to Africa and Asia known for scavenging and distinctive laughing call
examples: The spotted hyena hunts in packs across African savannas
Hyena clans have complex social structures led by females

definitions: conditions and practices that maintain health and prevent disease through cleanliness
examples: Good personal hygiene includes regular handwashing and dental care
The restaurant maintains strict kitchen hygiene standards for safety

definitions: song of praise typically sung in religious worship services
examples: The congregation sang traditional hymns during Sunday morning service
She composed a new hymn for the church anniversary celebration

definitions: book containing collection of hymns for use in religious worship
examples: Each church pew contained a worn hymnal for congregational singing
The new hymnal included both traditional and contemporary worship songs

definitions: extravagant or intensive publicity promotion often exceeding actual merit of product or event
examples: Media hype surrounded the new smartphone release for weeks
The movie failed to live up to its marketing hype

definitions: condition characterized by excessive physical movement and inability to remain still or focused
examples: The child's hyperactivity made classroom learning extremely challenging for everyone
Doctors prescribed medication to help manage his severe hyperactivity symptoms

definitions: open curve formed by intersection of cone with plane producing two symmetric branches
examples: Students graphed the hyperbola equation in their mathematics class
The comet followed a hyperbolic path around the sun

definitions: deliberate exaggeration used in speech or writing for emphasis or dramatic effect
examples: Saying you're starving when merely hungry is common hyperbole
The politician's speech was filled with hyperbole about opponents

definitions: very large retail store combining supermarket and department store under one roof
examples: The new hypermarket sells everything from groceries to electronics
European hypermarket chains expanded into Asian markets rapidly

definitions: abnormally high sensitivity to stimuli resulting in excessive physical or emotional responses
examples: Her hypersensitivity to pollen required constant allergy medication management
The patient developed hypersensitivity reactions to multiple food proteins

definitions: medical condition where blood pressure in arteries remains persistently elevated above normal levels
examples: Regular exercise helps prevent and manage hypertension in adults
The doctor prescribed medication to control her chronic hypertension

definitions: text displayed on computer containing links to other text that readers can access
examples: Websites use hypertext links to connect related pages together
The hypertext format revolutionized how people navigate digital information

definitions: punctuation mark used to join words or separate syllables
examples: The word mother-in-law requires hyphens between each part
Use a hyphen to connect compound adjectives before nouns

definitions: drug or substance that induces sleep or trance-like states in people
examples: The doctor prescribed a mild hypnotic for severe insomnia
Some hypnotic medications can cause dependency with prolonged use

definitions: practice of inducing hypnotic state in person through suggestion and focused attention
examples: Stage hypnotism entertains audiences with volunteer participants doing silly acts
Medical hypnotism helps some patients manage chronic pain effectively

definitions: person who practices hypnotism professionally for entertainment or therapeutic purposes
examples: The clinical hypnotist helped patients overcome smoking addiction successfully
The stage hypnotist made volunteers believe they were chickens

definitions: practice of claiming moral standards while behaving contrary to those stated beliefs
examples: Political hypocrisy occurs when leaders violate their own stated principles
The preacher's gambling exposed his hypocrisy about moral living

definitions: person who practices hypocrisy by pretending virtues they do not possess
examples: The environmental hypocrite drives a gas-guzzling vehicle daily
Don't be a hypocrite by criticizing others for your faults

definitions: hollow needle used to inject substances beneath the skin
examples: The nurse prepared a hypodermic needle for the vaccination
Diabetics often use hypodermic syringes for insulin injections

definitions: medical condition where blood glucose levels drop below normal range causing weakness and confusion
examples: Diabetics must monitor for signs of dangerous hypoglycemia episodes
Eating regular meals helps prevent hypoglycemia in sensitive individuals

definitions: life-threatening medical condition where body temperature drops below normal due to cold exposure
examples: Mountain climbers risk hypothermia in extreme weather conditions above treeline
The shipwreck survivors suffered from hypothermia in cold ocean water

definitions: imagined situation or example used for discussion that may not reflect actual reality
examples: The professor posed a hypothetical question about time travel
Let's consider a hypothetical scenario where robots replace workers

definitions: surgical procedure to remove woman's uterus for medical reasons
examples: The surgeon performed an emergency hysterectomy to stop severe bleeding
Recovery from hysterectomy typically takes several weeks of rest

definitions: exaggerated or uncontrollable emotion or excitement especially in group of people
examples: Mass hysteria swept through the crowd during the evacuation
The media coverage created unnecessary hysteria about the storm

definitions: portable digital music player device originally created by Apple company
examples: She listened to podcasts on her iPod during the commute
The first iPod revolutionized how people carried music collections

definitions: wild mountain goat with long curved horns found in mountainous regions
examples: The alpine ibex climbed steep rocky cliffs with amazing agility
Conservation efforts helped restore ibex populations in several countries

definitions: common over-the-counter medication used to reduce pain, fever, and inflammation
examples: She took ibuprofen to relieve her persistent headache symptoms
Ibuprofen reduces inflammation better than acetaminophen for joint pain

definitions: large floating mass of ice detached from glacier with most volume underwater
examples: The ship carefully navigated around the massive Atlantic iceberg
Only ten percent of an iceberg appears above water surface

definitions: ship designed to break through ice-covered waters
activity or remark intended to relieve tension between strangers
examples: The polar icebreaker cleared shipping lanes through frozen waters
Coast Guard icebreakers rescue vessels trapped in winter ice
The party host suggested an icebreaker game for guests
Good icebreaker questions help strangers feel more comfortable together

definitions: person who delivered ice blocks before refrigeration
preserved human body found frozen in ice from ancient times
examples: The iceman delivered blocks to homes before electric refrigerators
Old photographs show iceman wagons on city streets
Scientists studied the iceman discovered in the Alpine glacier
The prehistoric iceman provided insights into ancient human life

definitions: hanging pointed piece of ice formed by freezing of dripping water
examples: Dangerous icicles hung from the roof after the winter storm
Children knocked icicles off the porch with long sticks
